author: George Orwell
genres: Science Fiction, Dystopian, Political Fiction, Classic
description: A dystopian novel about totalitarianism and surveillance in a future superstate. Winston Smith struggles against oppressive government control and thought police in Oceania.

title: The Lord of the Rings: The Fellowship of the Ring
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
description: The first part of the epic trilogy where Frodo Baggins inherits a powerful ring. A fellowship forms to destroy the ring and prevent the Dark Lord Sauron from conquering Middle-earth.

title: The Lord of the Rings: The Two Towers
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
description: The second part follows the broken fellowship as they face new challenges. Frodo and Sam journey toward Mordor while their companions fight in the war against Sauron's forces.

title: The Lord of the Rings: The Return of the King
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
description: The final part depicts the epic battle for Middle-earth's fate. Aragorn claims his throne while Frodo completes his quest to destroy the One Ring in Mount Doom.

title: The Hobbit
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
description: A prequel to The Lord of the Rings about Bilbo Baggins' unexpected journey. The hobbit encounters trolls, elves, and a dragon while discovering a mysterious ring.

title: Pride and Prejudice
author: Jane Austen
genres: Romance, Classic, Historical Fiction, Comedy of Manners
description: A romantic novel set in Georgian England exploring marriage and social class. Elizabeth Bennet navigates prejudice and pride while falling in love with Mr. Darcy.

title: One Hundred Years of Solitude
author: Gabriel García Márquez
genres: Magical Realism, Literary Fiction, Historical Fiction, Family Saga
description: A multi-generational saga of the Buendía family in the fictional town of Macondo. The novel blends magical elements with Latin American history and explores themes of solitude and fate.

title: Crime and Punishment
author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
genres: Psychological Fiction, Philosophical Fiction, Classic, Crime
description: A psychological exploration of guilt and redemption in 19th century Russia. Rodion Raskolnikov commits murder and grapples with moral consequences and mental anguish.

title: The Little Prince
author: Antoine de Saint-Exupéry
genres: Fable, Children's Literature, Philosophical Fiction, Fantasy
description: A poetic fable about a young prince who travels between planets. The story explores themes of love, loss, and the importance of seeing with the heart.

title: Don Quixote
author: Miguel de Cervantes
description: A Spanish nobleman loses his sanity and becomes a knight-errant. Don Quixote embarks on absurd adventures with his squire Sancho Panza, tilting at windmills.

title: The Fault in Our Stars
author: John Green
genres: Romance, Young Adult, Contemporary Fiction, Drama
description: A poignant love story between two teenagers with cancer. Hazel and Augustus navigate terminal illness while finding meaning and love in their limited time together.

title: The Mists of Avalon
author: Marion Zimmer Bradley
genres: Fantasy, Historical Fiction, Arthurian Legend, Feminist Fiction
description: A feminist retelling of the Arthurian legends from the perspective of the women. The story follows Morgaine and other priestesses of Avalon as Christianity displaces the old pagan religions in Britain.

title: The Da Vinci Code
author: Dan Brown
description: A symbologist and cryptologist unravel a conspiracy hidden in Da Vinci's works. Robert Langdon races through Europe solving puzzles involving the Holy Grail and secret societies.

title: The Book Thief
author: Markus Zusak
genres: Historical Fiction, War Fiction, Coming-of-Age, Literary Fiction
description: Set in Nazi Germany, Death narrates the story of Liesel, a girl who steals books. The novel explores the power of words during World War II and the horrors of the Holocaust.

title: The Name of the Wind
author: Patrick Rothfuss
description: The first book chronicles the legendary wizard Kvothe's early life and adventures. A heroic figure recounts his youth, magical education, and the tragic events that shaped his destiny.

title: Mindset: The New Psychology of Success
author: Carol S. Dweck
description: A groundbreaking exploration of fixed versus growth mindsets and their impact. Research shows how believing abilities can be developed leads to greater achievement and resilience.

title: Thinking, Fast and Slow
author: Daniel Kahneman
description: A Nobel laureate explains two systems of thinking that drive human decisions. The book explores cognitive biases, heuristics, and how we make judgments and choices.

title: Sapiens: A Brief History of Humankind
author: Yuval Noah Harari
description: A sweeping narrative of human history from the Stone Age to modern times. The book examines how Homo sapiens came to dominate the world through cognitive, agricultural, and scientific revolutions.

title: The Power of Habit
author: Charles Duhigg
description: An exploration of the science behind habit formation and change. The book reveals how habits work in individuals, organizations, and societies, offering strategies for transformation.

title: The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy
author: Douglas Adams
description: A comedic space adventure following Arthur Dent after Earth's destruction. Armed with a peculiar guidebook, he travels the galaxy encountering absurd aliens and improbable situations.
collection: The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy

title: Brave New World
author: Aldous Huxley
genres: Science Fiction, Dystopian, Philosophical Fiction, Classic
description: A dystopian vision of a future world controlled by technology and conditioning. Society prioritizes stability and pleasure through genetic engineering, drugs, and psychological manipulation.

title: Animal Farm
author: George Orwell
description: A satirical allegory using farm animals to critique totalitarian regimes. The pigs lead a revolution against humans but gradually become indistinguishable from their former oppressors.

title: To Kill a Mockingbird
author: Harper Lee
genres: Historical Fiction, Coming-of-Age, Legal Drama, Classic
description: A powerful story of racial injustice in 1930s Alabama. Scout Finch learns about courage and compassion as her father defends a Black man falsely accused of rape.
